headers: CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE

rows.CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE: The spreadsheet is the database. Claude is the UI. Nobody navigates 688 tabs directly.
THE LEGIBILITY PROBLEM
A 688-tab spreadsheet organized into 41 models across 7 clusters with proprietary concepts
like TUPs, semesters, compliance managers, delegation depth, and school model â€”
most PMs, most experts, most investors will look at this and not know what they're looking at.
This is not a bug. The complexity is real. A business IS this complex.
The problem is that humans can't navigate this complexity in raw spreadsheet form.
But Claude can.
HOW EACH ROLE USES CLAUDE
Role
Lead PM
rows.col_2: "Generate first draft of M28 Market & Expansion. Here is the thesis from M0."
rows.col_3: Pulls M28 tab structure, fills all 20 tabs using M0 inputs, flags assumptions, produces review-ready output.
rows.col_4: Raw spreadsheet. Tab navigation. Cross-model dependency resolution.

rows.CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE: Cluster PM
rows.col_2: "Here is expert feedback on M5 Supply Chain. Incorporate and show me what changed."
rows.col_3: Reads expert markup, revises all 13 tabs, lists every change with rationale, highlights remaining gaps.
rows.col_4: Finding which tabs are in M5. Understanding tab dependencies. Formatting.

rows.CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE: Expert
rows.col_2: "Walk me through the financial model. What are the key assumptions?"
rows.col_3: Synthesizes M3 into a 5-minute verbal overview. Highlights assumptions. Answers follow-up questions in real time.
rows.col_4: The spreadsheet entirely. Expert sees a conversational summary, not 15 tabs.

rows.CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE: Venture Partner
rows.col_2: "Give me a 2-page summary of the IonWave opportunity for an investor I want to introduce."
rows.col_3: Pulls from M0 (thesis), M3 (financials), M25 (competitive intel), M33 (trade architecture). Produces investor-ready summary.
rows.col_4: Which models exist. Where data lives. How to synthesize across clusters.

rows.CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE: Investor
rows.col_2: "What are the unit economics? What are the key risks? What is the team plan?"
rows.col_3: Answers from M3, M0, M30, M31. Provides specific numbers, specific risks, specific hiring timeline.
rows.col_4: The operating model. They see answers, not architecture.

rows.CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE: CEO Recruiter
rows.col_2: "Produce a pitch for CEO candidates. What would they be walking into?"
rows.col_3: Synthesizes entire Trade into candidate-facing narrative: the opportunity, the system, the team, the economics, the governance, the upside.
rows.col_4: Trade structure. They see a compelling recruiting pitch.

rows.CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE: CEO / Operator
rows.col_2: "What do I do this week? What are my priorities?"
rows.col_3: Reads Trade Execution Tracker, School Calendar, current semester goals. Produces prioritized weekly plan with specific actions.
rows.col_4: Navigating 688 tabs to figure out what matters right now.

rows.CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE: CM (Compliance Manager)
rows.col_2: "Grade the Operator on Semester 1. Pull all metrics and milestone data."
rows.col_3: Reads KPI Dashboard, Semester Report Card, Trade Execution Tracker, CRM Metrics. Produces comprehensive grade with evidence.
rows.col_4: Manually pulling data from 10+ tabs. Cross-referencing metrics.

rows.CLAUDE AS HUMAN INTERFACE TO THE TRADE: WHAT THIS MEANS FOR PRODUCTION
The PM job description changes. It's not 'can you manage a complex spreadsheet.'
It's 'can you have productive conversations with Claude and manage a feedback loop.'
The expert engagement changes. You don't send an expert 16 tabs and hope they read them.
You put Claude on a call, Claude walks the expert through the content, the expert reacts.
The investor pitch changes. You don't show a spreadsheet.
You demo Claude navigating the Trade in real time, answering any question instantly.
The CEO onboarding changes. The Operator doesn't read 688 tabs.
They ask Claude 'what do I do today' and Claude knows.
The legibility constraint dissolves. The Trade can be as complex as it needs to be
because no human ever interacts with the complexity directly.
Claude is the translator between human understanding and system complexity.
